name: Regional Quality Systems Specialist Russia-CIS
description:
The Job:

Regional Quality Systems Specialist will contribute to building and maintenance of QMS in RU-CIS Abbott Region in compliance with Abbott standards and with current legislation locally as well as internationally.

Quality Assurance and QMS maintenance:

  • Support responsible area(s) in critical Quality-processes including, but not limited to document control, quality training program, non-conformities, CAPA, internal audits and external inspections
  • Stay aware on updates in regulatory requirements related to Regional QMS in the supported markets
  • Assist QS Manager in periodic QA management meetings and respective data collection in area of responsibility
  • Act as Regional SME for IT QA systems (Documentation, Training, NCR and CAPA), provide trainings within Regional QA organization on QA electronic systems user roles
  • Contribute to Regional and Divisional QMS projects and initiatives

Maintenance of RU-CIS Regional QA Training System:

  • Under guidance of Regional QS Manager identify training needs for Regional QA Organization through the respective functional leads/heads;
  • Facilitate/arrange training Modules/Curricula for identified training needs; assign trainings in electronic system, reconciliation of missing training requirements and past due training sessions;
  • Keep regional QA training matrix up to date and perform annual revision and actualization of assigned training plans together with respective functional leads
  • Prepare training Metrics/KPIs for Regional QA Organization employees and circulate to Senior Leadership

Regional QA Documentation:

  • RU-CIS QA Regional Documentation and Records management and distribution
  • Manage periodic revision schedule for Regional SOPs/ Guidelines
  • Assist QA document owners and authors in workflows processing in electronic Document Management System
  • Develop and implement regional QMS SOPs as applicable in the area of responsibility and ensure they are reviewed by appropriate staff and departments and conform to corporate standards
  • Maintain Regional QA Documentation Index

Audits and External Inspections

  • Follow-up on exceptions and non-conformities raised during regional and corporate QA audits
  • Raise and investigate exceptions and non-conformities in the area of responsibility; develop and execute appropriate CAPA plans
  • Support Affiliates within Region in preparation to regional and corporate audits
  • Support Regional QS Manager in local GMP certification program (technical support to the sites during inspection readiness activities; local applicant representation on site during inspections, monitoring of sites CAPA plans execution, collection and translation of respective closure evidences and their submission to the authority)

Qualifications:

  • Degree in engineering field or Chemistry/Biochemistry/Microbiology or Computer Science
  • Experienced user of electronic systems (for documentation or process management)
  • English fluent/upper-intermediate
  • High proficiency with MS Office, Windows, SharePoint, ) with demonstrated skills in the use of word processing, spreadsheets, databases & information management systems additional eQMS knowledge is a plus

Work experience:

  • 3-5 years of experience in GMP or ISO regulated industry
  • Assiduity, attention to details, ability to process and analyze big volumes of data in multiple systems
  • Ability to proactively anticipate multiple deadlines, and drive and manage project priorities
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to interact with staff on all levels and within a culturally diverse environment
